casebody.data:
Case No. 1,123. BAXTER v. BIAYS.

[Brunner, Col. Cas. 254; 1

4 Law J. 276.] Circuit Court. D. Maryland. May Term, 1812. Bail—Surrender op Principal. Bail cannot surrender their principal before n judge at his chambers. Biays was bail for one Merrihu. After the scire facias issued, and within the time allowed by the rule for a surrender of principal, Biays surrendered Merrihu before HOUSTON, District Judge, during vacation, who ordered an exoneretur to be entered.

But by

DUVAL, Circuit Justice:

There is no law authorizing a surrender before a judge at his chambers, nor is there any rule of court to that effect. It was once attempted before Judge Hanson, and refused.
